item.title: Beogram 4002: From Oil Cleanup to First Operational Test
item.description:
The Beogram 4002 restoration hit a snag. Although the main board was restored, the presence of rust and corrosion discovered earlier took priority. Addressing rust requires applying neutralizer and paint, which involves drying time between coats, thus delaying the planned reservoir capacitor and output board work. Images highlighting the most severe rust spots are included. Despite the significant rust, the turntable’s overall condition is good. To combat the rust, three coats of rust neutralizer were applied...

item.title: Beogram 4002: Final Tasks, Adjustments & Playing Records
item.description:
The final steps of a Beogram 4002 Type 5513 restoration project involved addressing corrosion damage and replacing the 5-pin DIN phono plug. Using a helpful audio path diagram, continuity checks were performed from the cartridge connector to ensure proper signal flow. The replacement phono plug, a REAN model with gold contact pins, was installed, though the tight fit of the rubber boot on the cable posed a minor challenge. As an improvement, a grounding switch was added to the output board, eliminating the need for an external grounding wire...
